p.s: There are big differences between the novel's scene and the movie's one.
The most important one is the context of the cops showing up.
While in the novel it's Mav and his neighbor arguing (normally, without violence) it's a little harsher in the movie.
There, Mav and King were about to actually fight with the possibility to end bloody.

That's a normal reason for cops to intervene (without treating Mav and his family that disrespectful), while in the book it's really an example of police violence against innocent, since Mav and the neighbor tried to convince the cops that everything's right and nothing happened.
Still they treat Mav as harsh as in the movie, what fits more into the whole idea of the story, police violence and racism.
The movie's version still does the job, but not hald as well as the book version.
